annotations: The Carpathians are a mountain range that stretches through several countries, including Ukraine and Poland.
Elbrus is the highest mountain in Europe, located in the Caucasus Mountains.
The Rockies, or Rocky Mountains, are a major mountain range in western North America.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world, located in the Himalayas.
K2, also known as Mount Godwin-Austen, is the second-highest mountain on Earth.
The Andes is the longest continental mountain range in the world, extending through seven countries in South America.
Denali, also known as Mount McKinley, is the highest mountain peak in North America.
The Alps are the highest and most extensive mountain range system that lies entirely in Europe.
Matterhorn is a famous mountain in the Pennine Alps on the border between Switzerland and Italy.
The Ural Mountains form a natural boundary between Europe and Asia.
Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa, located in Tanzania.
The Appalachian Mountains are a system of mountains in eastern North America.
Aconcagua is the highest mountain outside of Asia, located in the Andes range.
Mount Fuji is an iconic volcano and the highest peak in Japan.
The Sierra Nevada is a mountain range in the western United States.
